for_sales.sales_text:
Offers invited.

Heard 23 GRP Gaff Cutter built in 1987 by Martin Heard at Tregatreath, to the cruising design of Percy Dalton, on the distinctive Terry Heard Falmouth Working Boat hull. Length 23ft 3in, beam 8ft, draft 4ft 4in, length over spars 35ft with displacement of 5 tonnes.   She has cream main, with 2 deep reefs, roller staysail, and jib on a traveller. Cream cockpit cover, with a boom gallows aft. Keel stepped Collars mast, new in 2023. She has a 2021 20HP Beta20 inboard diesel engine with gearbox and heat exchanger cooling. Steering compass, small usable chart table, galley sink and Origo double meths burners, and Portapotti enable her to go anywhere. Lots of ropes, with Tufnol blocks, make her a traditional boat that people are pleased to see sailing and at various Cornish classics rallies. Price reflects need for some boatyard time. Lying Helford, Cornwall. Contact: jeremy.mccabe@btinternet.com

boat.full_description:
Pica has been mainly day sailed with the family from the Helford River, but she has also competed in several Fowey Classics.

Over the years she has received a new mail and staysail, as well as requiring a new rudder and stemhead.
boat.name: Pica
